#Text=AN ETUDE FOR EMMA
#Text=If you listen long enough , and earnestly enough , and with ear sufficiently attuned to the music of this sphere there will come to you this reward :

#Text=The violins and oboes and ' cellos and brasses of humanity which seemed all at variance with each other will unite as one instrument ; seeming discords and dissonances will blend into harmony , and the wail and blare and thrum of humanity 's orchestra will sound in your ear the sublime melody of that great symphony called Life .

#Text=In her sunny little private office on the twelfth floor of the great loft-building that housed the T. A. Buck Company , Emma McChesney Buck sat listening to the street-sounds that were wafted to her , mellowed by height and distance .
#Text=The noises , taken separately , were the nerve-racking sounds common to a busy down-town New York cross-street .

#Text=By the time they reached the little office on the twelfth floor , they were softened , mellowed , debrutalized , welded into a weird choirlike chant first high , then low , rising , swelling , dying away , rising again to a dull roar , with now and then vast undertones like the rumbling of a cathedral pipe-organ .
#Text=Emma knew that the high , clear tenor note was the shrill cry of the lame " newsie " at the corner of Sixth Avenue and Twenty-sixth Street .
#Text=Those deep , thunderous bass notes were the combined reverberation of nearby " L " trains , distant subway and clanging surface cars .
#Text=That sharp staccato was a motorman clanging his bell of warning .
#Text=These things she knew .
#Text=But she liked , nevertheless , to shut her eyes for a moment in the midst of her busy day and listen to the chant of the city as it came up to her , subdued , softened , strangely beautified .
#Text=The sound saddened even while it filled her with a certain exaltation .
#Text=We have no one word for that sensation .
#Text=The German ( there 's a language ! ) has it -- Weltschmerz .
#Text=As distance softened the harsh sounds to her ears , so time and experience had given her a perspective on life itself .
#Text=She saw it , not as a series of incidents , pleasant and unpleasant , but as a great universal scheme too mighty to comprehend -- a scheme that always worked itself out in some miraculous way .
#Text=She had had a singularly full life , had Emma McChesney Buck .
#Text=A life replete with work , leavened by sorrows , sweetened with happiness .
#Text=These ingredients make for tolerance .
#Text=She saw , for example , how the capable , modern staff in the main business office had forged ahead of old Pop Henderson .
#Text=Pop Henderson had been head bookkeeper for years .
#Text=But the pen in his trembling hand made queer spidery marks in the ledgers now , and his figure seven was very likely to look like a drunken letter " z.
